episodeTitle: The Conclusion of the Deadly Battle! A Spear of Blind Determination!
episodeTitleJapanese: 死闘の決着！腹にくくった１本の槍！
episodeTitleRomanized: Shitō no Ketchaku! Hara ni kukutta ippon no yari!
description: Luffy defeats Don Krieg by destroying his golden armor with a powerful Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi attack. Following the defeat, Gin orders the Krieg Pirates to retreat from the Baratie. Meanwhile, Nami grieves about stealing the Going Merry, reflecting on her desire for freedom and remembering Bell-mère.

events.title: Luffy vs Krieg Final Confrontation
events.description: Luffy engages Don Krieg in the climactic battle on the Baratie's fin. Despite Krieg's arsenal of weapons and defensive armor, Luffy focuses his attacks on destroying Krieg's equipment piece by piece.
events.significance: Sets up the final phase of the Baratie Arc's main conflict. Demonstrates Luffy's strategic approach to defeating an opponent with superior weaponry.

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Bazooka on Krieg's Armor
events.description: Luffy strikes Krieg with a powerful Gomu Gomu no Bazooka attack, cracking the golden Wootz Steel armor. He follows up with a second Gomu Gomu no Bazooka that shatters significant portions of the armor.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's raw power is sufficient to damage even the strongest armor in the East Blue. Begins to strip away Krieg's defensive advantages.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy attacking Krieg's armor with his signature double-palm strike

events.title: Krieg's Desperation Net Trap
events.description: Realizing he's losing, Don Krieg deploys a massive net to trap Luffy, intending to drag both of them into the sea where Luffy's Devil Fruit weakness would ensure his death. Krieg is willing to risk his own life to defeat Luffy.
events.significance: Shows Krieg's ruthless determination and willingness to use any means necessary, even suicide tactics. Highlights the danger of fighting Devil Fruit users near water.

quotes.text: If I can't have victory, I'll drag you down to the depths with me!
quotes.speaker: Don Krieg
quotes.context: Krieg attempting to trap Luffy in the net to drown them both

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi Debut
events.description: While trapped in Krieg's net, Luffy demonstrates his creativity by using a new technique: Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi (Gum-Gum Giant Hammer). He grabs Krieg's face with his feet, stretches his legs, and slams Krieg into the Baratie's fin with devastating force, knocking him unconscious.
events.significance: First appearance of Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi, demonstrating Luffy's ability to improvise new techniques in combat. Shows his versatility in using his rubber powers with his legs as well as his arms.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy debuting his new leg-based hammer technique to defeat Krieg

events.title: Don Krieg's Defeat
events.description: After being struck by Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi, Don Krieg crashes into the Baratie's fin and is knocked unconscious. His golden armor is completely destroyed, and the self-proclaimed strongest man in the East Blue is definitively defeated.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Baratie Arc's main conflict. Establishes Luffy as capable of defeating the East Blue's most notorious pirate captains. Proves that cunning and determination can overcome superior weaponry.

events.title: Luffy Falls Into the Sea
events.description: After defeating Krieg, Luffy begins to fall into the ocean due to exhaustion and his Devil Fruit weakness. Sanji quickly dives in to rescue him from drowning.
events.significance: Demonstrates the constant danger Devil Fruit users face around water and reinforces the bond between Luffy and Sanji as crewmates.

events.title: Krieg's Hysterical Breakdown
events.description: After regaining consciousness, Don Krieg refuses to accept his defeat and enters a hysterical state. He begins attacking his own crew members indiscriminately in a rage-fueled breakdown, unable to comprehend his loss.
events.significance: Reveals Krieg's true character as a tyrant who only cares about his own pride. Contrasts with Gin's honor and sets up Gin's final act of loyalty.

quotes.text: I can't lose! I'm the strongest! I'm Don Krieg!
quotes.speaker: Don Krieg
quotes.context: Krieg in denial about his defeat, attacking his own crew

events.title: Gin Strikes Down Krieg
events.description: To protect the crew from Krieg's rampage, Gin strikes his captain and knocks him unconscious. This act demonstrates Gin's moral code and his willingness to defy his captain when necessary to protect others.
events.significance: Major character moment for Gin showing his true nature as an honorable pirate despite serving under a tyrant. Demonstrates the complex loyalty dynamics in pirate crews.

quotes.text: That's enough, Captain. This battle is over.
quotes.speaker: Gin
quotes.context: Gin stopping Krieg's rampage by striking him down

events.title: Krieg Pirates Retreat from Baratie
events.description: Gin takes command and orders the Krieg Pirates to retreat from the Baratie. The crew, understanding they've been defeated, follows Gin's orders and prepares to leave the restaurant.
events.significance: Marks the official end of the Krieg Pirates' invasion of the Baratie. Shows Gin's leadership and the crew's respect for him over their defeated captain.

quotes.text: All hands, prepare to retreat! The battle is over!
quotes.speaker: Gin
quotes.context: Gin ordering the Krieg Pirates to leave the Baratie

events.title: Gin and Sanji's Farewell
events.description: Before departing, Gin has a heartfelt farewell with Sanji, thanking him for the kindness and food he provided. Despite being enemies, their mutual respect and the bond formed through Sanji's compassion is evident.
events.significance: Emotional culmination of the Gin/Sanji subplot. Reinforces One Piece's theme that kindness and honor transcend allegiances. Sets up Gin's promise to meet again.

quotes.text: I won't forget what you did for me. Thank you for the food.
quotes.speaker: Gin
quotes.context: Gin expressing gratitude to Sanji before leaving

quotes.text: Take care of yourself out there.
quotes.speaker: Sanji

events.title: Gin's Promise to Meet Again on the Grand Line
events.description: As he escorts the defeated Krieg away, Gin makes a promise to Luffy and Sanji that he will rebuild his crew and meet them again on the Grand Line. This foreshadows a potential future reunion.
events.significance: Sets up long-term narrative potential for Gin's return. Establishes the Grand Line as the ultimate destination where all pirates' paths will cross again.

quotes.text: We'll meet again on the Grand Line. I promise you that.
quotes.speaker: Gin
quotes.context: Gin promising to meet Luffy and Sanji again in the future

events.title: Sanji Provides Supply Ship to Krieg Pirates
events.description: In a final act of compassion, Sanji gives the Krieg Pirates the Baratie's supply ship to aid their retreat. This gesture of kindness toward defeated enemies exemplifies Sanji's philosophy that no one should go hungry.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's unwavering principles about food and compassion, even toward those who tried to destroy his home. Reinforces his character as someone who feeds anyone in need.

quotes.text: Take the supply ship. No one should starve at sea.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji giving provisions to the defeated pirates

events.title: Nami's Emotional Breakdown on the Going Merry
events.description: Aboard the stolen Going Merry, Nami breaks down crying, lamenting that she had to steal the ship. She expresses her desire to be free and mentions Bell-mère, her adoptive mother, revealing her emotional turmoil.
events.significance: First explicit reference to Bell-mère in the anime, foreshadowing Nami's tragic backstory. Sets up the Arlong Park Arc and Nami's internal conflict.

quotes.text: I just want to be free... Bell-mère...
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami crying alone on the Going Merry, thinking about her adoptive mother

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy debuting his new leg-based hammer technique to defeat Krieg

quotes.text: We'll meet again on the Grand Line. I promise you that.
quotes.speaker: Gin
quotes.context: Gin promising to meet Luffy and Sanji again in the future

quotes.text: I won't forget what you did for me. Thank you for the food.
quotes.speaker: Gin
quotes.context: Gin expressing gratitude to Sanji before leaving

quotes.text: Take the supply ship. No one should starve at sea.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji giving provisions to the defeated pirates

quotes.text: I just want to be free... Bell-mère...
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami crying alone on the Going Merry, thinking about her adoptive mother

themes.description: Despite being on opposite sides, Gin and Sanji demonstrate mutual respect and honor. Gin's gratitude and Sanji's compassion transcend their roles as enemies.
themes.symbolism: The food Sanji provides represents basic human compassion that exists even in conflict.

themes.description: Don Krieg's complete breakdown after defeat reveals that his strength was built on fear and pride rather than genuine leadership. His loss exposes his weakness.
themes.symbolism: Krieg's shattered golden armor represents the fragility of power built solely on weapons and intimidation.

themes.description: Gin's promise to meet again on the Grand Line establishes the recurring theme that the Grand Line is where all pirates' destinies intersect.
themes.symbolism: The Grand Line represents the ultimate testing ground where all paths converge.

themes.description: Sanji's decision to provide supplies to the defeated Krieg Pirates demonstrates his philosophy that feeding people transcends conflict and allegiance.
themes.symbolism: The supply ship represents Sanji's core belief that no one deserves to starve, regardless of their actions.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates growth in combat creativity by adapting to Krieg's trap with a new technique. Shows determination to protect his friends and the Baratie.
keyActions: Destroys Krieg's armor with Gomu Gomu no Bazooka
Debuts Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi while trapped
Defeats Don Krieg decisively
Needs to be rescued from the sea by Sanji

characterSpotlights.development: His facade as the strongest pirate in the East Blue crumbles completely. His breakdown reveals his true nature as a prideful tyrant unable to accept defeat.
keyActions: Attempts suicide trap with net
Is defeated by Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi
Enters hysterical breakdown after defeat
Attacks his own crew before being stopped by Gin
Is carried away unconscious by his crew
quotes: If I can't have victory, I'll drag you down to the depths with me!
I can't lose! I'm the strongest! I'm Don Krieg!

characterSpotlights.development: Takes decisive leadership when Krieg fails. Demonstrates his true character as an honorable pirate with a moral code that transcends blind loyalty.
keyActions: Knocks out Krieg to protect the crew
Orders the Krieg Pirates to retreat
Thanks Sanji for his kindness
Promises to meet Luffy and Sanji on the Grand Line
Escorts the defeated Krieg away
quotes: That's enough, Captain. This battle is over.
I won't forget what you did for me. Thank you for the food.
We'll meet again on the Grand Line. I promise you that.

characterSpotlights.development: Continues to demonstrate his core philosophy that everyone deserves to eat. Shows the depth of his character through compassion toward defeated enemies.
keyActions: Rescues Luffy from drowning
Shares emotional farewell with Gin
Provides supply ship to the Krieg Pirates
Accepts Gin's gratitude with grace
quotes: Take the supply ship. No one should starve at sea.
Take care of yourself out there.

characterSpotlights.development: Her emotional breakdown on the Going Merry reveals the depth of her internal conflict and foreshadows her tragic backstory with Bell-mère.
keyActions: Cries alone on the Going Merry
Expresses desire for freedom
Mentions Bell-mère for the first time
Struggles with guilt over stealing the ship
quotes: I just want to be free... Bell-mère...

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends Luffy's battle with Krieg with additional action sequences and more detailed animation of the Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi technique.
Nami's emotional scene on the Going Merry receives more screen time and detail in the anime, emphasizing her tears and emotional state.

trivia.fact: Episode 29 marks the debut of Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi, one of Luffy's signature leg-based attacks that he continues to use throughout the series.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi/Techniques - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode adapts manga Chapters 65 (p. 2-19), 66 (p. 2-19), and 67 (p. 2-6), covering approximately 2.5 chapters in one episode.
The original Japanese broadcast on June 21, 2000 achieved a 10.6% television rating, showing strong viewership for the Baratie Arc conclusion.
Gin's promise to meet Luffy again on the Grand Line was fulfilled much later in the manga (Chapter 1117), confirming he survived and made it to the New World.

sources.title: One Piece Confirms the Long-Awaited Return of an Early Character

trivia.fact: This is the last episode featuring 'Memories' by Maki Otsuki as the ending theme, as it runs from Episode 1-30.

The episode had multiple English titles: 'The End of the Battle Between Luffy and Krieg' (Odex), 'The Crack of Don' (4Kids), and 'The Conclusion of the Deadly Battle! A Spear of Blind Determination' (Funimation).
